title: Kolmogorov automorphism
summary: In mathematics, a Kolmogorov automorphism, K-automorphism, K-shift or K-system is an invertible, measure-preserving automorphism defined on a standard probability space that obeys Kolmogorov's zeroâ€“one law.[1]  All Bernoulli automorphisms are K-automorphisms (one says they have the K-property), but not vice versa.  Many ergodic dynamical systems have been shown to have the K-property, although more recent research has shown that many of these are in fact Bernoulli automorphisms.
